page.title: 17HOME LIFE IN ASTON-J-MONDRUM
page.content: The{dairy farmer's routine}is often substantially different from the rest of the family.His day begins between 5 & 6.30 when the cows need milking. His {1st meal}is a cooked breakfast about 9 a.m.whilst the rest of the family have eaten earlier.The whole family eat an {evening meal}together on most days. Others start their day between 7 & 8. Their routine is decided by needs of any animals kept,occupations,transport of children to school etc.The children of secondary school age usually travel to Nantwich by{school bus}chartered by Cheshire Education Authority although a few groups make use of the family car.{Most households own at least one car and many children and adults own and use{bicycles}. Adult{bedtimes}vary from 10 pm to midnight, often after an evening's television viewing.
